meanings.definition: To move up and down in a jerky manner
meanings.sent1: The toy bobbled on the table.
meanings.sent2: The jellyfish bobbled in the water.
meanings.sent3: The balloon bobbled away in the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her ponytail bobbled as she ran.
meanings.sent5: The cork bobbled on the surface of the water.

meanings.definition: To make a mistake or error
meanings.sent1: He bobbled the catch during the game.
meanings.sent2: She bobbled the answer during the quiz.
meanings.sent3: The robot bobbled the task and dropped the item.
meanings.sent4: The chef bobbled the recipe and added too much salt.
meanings.sent5: The student bobbled the presentation by forgetting a key point.

meanings.definition: A small ball of fabric or thread on a garment
meanings.sent1: The sweater had a colorful bobble on the sleeve.
meanings.sent2: She sewed a cute bobble onto the hat.
meanings.sent3: The bobble on the scarf added a fun touch.
meanings.sent4: The dress had delicate bobbles along the hem.
meanings.sent5: The pillow was decorated with fluffy bobbles.
